title: Event Is Not Emitted when Transaction Reverts
content:
**Update**
Marked as "Fixed" by the client. Addressed in: `dd79d7f`.

![Image 82: Alert icon](https://certificate.quantstamp.com/full/sapien/ffb7e698-6178-46f0-8df8-52e537af70c0/static/media/success-icon-alert.4e26c8d3b65fdf9f4f0789a4086052ba.svg)

**Update**
Marked as "Fixed" by the client. Addressed in: `3f9a00380d668b7879b62d0fa86ed1c43cdb9736`. The client provided the following explanation:

> Premature event emission removed and appropriate event emission now happening.

![Image 83: Alert icon](https://certificate.quantstamp.com/full/sapien/ffb7e698-6178-46f0-8df8-52e537af70c0/static/media/success-icon-alert.4e26c8d3b65fdf9f4f0789a4086052ba.svg)

**Update**
Marked as "Fixed" by the client. Addressed in: `3f9a00380d668b7879b62d0fa86ed1c43cdb9736`. The client provided the following explanation:

> Premature event emission removed and appropriate event emission now happening.

**File(s) affected:**`Rewards.sol`

**Description:** The `claimReward()` function emits a `WithdrawalProcessed` event before potentially reverting the transaction. This event emission is redundant as all state changes including events are rolled back when a transaction reverts in the EVM. In the case where `success` is `false`, the `WithdrawalProcessed` event will never be visible on-chain.

**Recommendation:** Remove the premature event emission and only emit events after confirming the operation's success.
